answers.answer: Diabetes can cause liver enzymes to go up.A normal blood sugar 2 hours after eating is 140-160.  Even if it goes up to 180 two hours after eating, it would be okay.  Not perfect, but okay.  After that, it should start going down.  So a blood sugar should never be higher than 200 no matter what you ate....because your pancreas should produce enough insulin to take care of it.Make sure your doctor treats it because insulin resistance and diabetes lower SVR.  If your blood sugar remains high, it will increase the insulin resistance. Also, ask him to send you to see a dietician or diabetes educator who can teach you about diet.

question: My blood sugar on last test was 226 but I did not fast. Abowl of cherrios and 2 percent milk.  The doctor has me scheduled for a fasting test. But was wondering if anyone on the forum has developed Diabeties on treatment.  I am on week 34.  Not been easy at all.  My AST and ALT have also raised during treatment.  I have been und since week 8.I am geno 1A,  But my alt and ast are now at 113 and 156.  When I started treatment they were 22 and 19 and have been going studily up every month,  I go to a GI and he does not have a clue to why they are rising..  Any insight ?
title: Has anyone developed diabeties on treatment
